title: The Mystery Of Tappan Zee: Why Build A Bridge Where The River's Wide?
teaser: If you've ever driven up the East Coast, you may have driven over the Tappan Zee Bridge. The span — north of New York City — was built in the spot that seems to make the least economic sense. Why?
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
